text: {| class="vcard" border=1 cellpadding=2 cellspacing=0 align=right width=260 style=margin-left:0.5em; |- !class="fn org" colspan=2 align=center bgcolor="#ff9999"|Hassocks & Burgess Hill South |- |colspan=2 align=center|240px Shown within West Sussex |- class="note" |width="45%"|District:||Mid Sussex |- class="note" |UK Parliament Constituency:||Arundel & South Downs, Mid Sussex |- class="note" |Ceremonial county:||West Sussex |- class="note" |EU Constituency:||South East England |- class="note" |Electorate (2009):||9703 |- !colspan=2 align=center bgcolor="#ff9999"|County Councillor |- |colspan=2 align=center | Kirsty Lord (LD) |} Hassocks & Burgess Hill South is an electoral division of West Sussex in the United Kingdom, and returns one member to sit on West Sussex County Council. ==Extent== The division covers the southwestern part of the town of Burgess Hill and the villages of Clayton, Hassocks and Keymer. As of 2017 it comprises the southern part of Meeds ward (Burgess Hill) along with the Hammonds Ridge estate (Burgess Hill) and Hassocks Ward. ==Election results== ===2017 Election=== Results of the election held on 4 May 2017: ==References== ==External links== * West Sussex County Council * Election Maps Category:Electoral Divisions of West Sussex
title: Hassocks & Burgess Hill South (electoral division)
